sentence.idiomatic: If I keep doing calisthenics every day will I be in perfect shape?
Shaping a good corporate image is of great benefit to a corporation's long-term expansion.
This novel formed the image of a successful career woman who achieves success through her hard work.
When you are dancing your expression and movements can't be too rigid. You must do your best to relax.
When we got to the topic she was most unwilling to talk about, her smile immediately turned stiff.
Your leg muscles are a little bit stiff. First do some warm-up exercises.
This product's weight-loss effects are longer lasting.
His interest in things doesn't last long; he tires of things very quickly.
Relationships built on the basis of money won't last very long.
The thing I least want to see are grammar books--they're both dull and difficult to understand.
If you always use one kind of teaching method, it's only natural that the students will feel it is monotonous and dull.
Every day it's my job to sort and deliver the mail. There is nothing creative about it at all--it's so dull I could die.
I'm such a trustworthy person, how could I be playing tricks?
As soon as he saw the situation was turning bad, he started to think of a way to get away with it.
We've agreed ahead of time that the loser has to pay for the meal--no getting out of it.
I totally lost face today--can you imagine that I wore my clothes inside out?
You have to win the game this time. Don't make our class lose face again.
How could you let that get out? You made me totally lose face in front of everyone.
He did something wrong and not only refuses to admit his mistake, but he's also so stubborn about it. It's really just too much.
Everyone knows he's the one who did that, but he's still being stubborn about it, and won't admit it.
He's in a rotten mood right now, it would be best not to say anything. Quibbling won't be of any advantage to you.
Look at you, growing that spare tire. Exercise with me.
But don't you hate going to the gym more than anything?
It's not like the gym is the only place you can exercise. Every day I systematically do sit-ups, push-ups, and chin-ups in order to tone my muscles and stay in shape. Look, the effects are not bad!

word.literal: to do for half the day

sentence.idiomatic: Oh, after all that it's just these basic exercises. This counts as a workout? The exercise machines in the gym work on strength and stamina and get fast, good results. Plus you can check out the girls.

You perv. Can't even stop macking to work out. Don't underestimate these simple exercises. They exercise the different parts of the body. The overall results are quite good. Plus the muscle you build is very natural. It's not like the inflexible muscle that a gym will give you, four bulky limbs and a simple mind.
This is a classic ``sour grapes" attitude. That kind of muscle is sculpted. Besides, your exercise method takes too long to get results. How many sit-ups do you need to do to get a six-pack?

word.literal: to go on a business trip

sentence.idiomatic: But the effects of these exercises are lasting. Also, because they're convenient, they're not limited by location. So whether it's at home or on a business trip, you can always easily do them. It really is truly making exercise a part of your life. It's not like going to the gym--a nuisance and dull. It's no wonder so many people quit in the end.
Fine! Enough empty talk. Let's talk facts.
No problem! We'll do something real! I'll make you see the power of push-ups and chin-ups.
In arm wrestling there's no way you can beat me. Hey, you can't move your body.
Like I need to use tricks? Are you ready? 1, 2, 3. Ha, your arm is so soft and flabby, like a piece of tofu. You have really lost face for the gym!
I didn't eat breakfast today. Normally I would totally beat you.
Give it up. The way I see it, you don't have any real strength in your whole body. You just talk tough.
